meta.title: The Humorist - Witty Warmth
meta.description: Intelligent humor meets approachable warmth. A publication-meets-app-hub aesthetic - editorial sophistication with interactive accessibility. Smart but never pretentious, colorful but never garish. The aesthetic of wit, wisdom, and a knowing wink.
meta.product-type: Publication-style hub with app-like navigation to AI agents

typography.principle: Wide geometric sans-serif conveys friendly confidence. The Lexend superfamily provides warmth and readability while maintaining visual hierarchy through width variation.

font.name: Lexend Giga
font.note: Extra-wide geometric sans. The width commands attention while remaining approachable.

font.name: Lexend Giga
font.note: SemiBold weight in muted color creates visual depth without severity

font.name: Lexend Giga
font.note: Black weight for small but impactful text

font.name: Lexend Peta
font.note: Extra-wide for maximum impact. Use sparingly.

font.name: Lexend
font.note: Light weight keeps large body text readable and friendly

avoid.reason: Serif fonts undermine the friendly, modern personality. This aesthetic is decisively sans-serif.

color.principle: Warm and welcoming as a foundation, with a rainbow spectrum of accents that bring playfulness without chaos. Colors are soft, never neon. The Solarized-inspired base provides visual comfort for extended reading.

color.name: cream
color.description: Warm cream background - easy on eyes, inviting. Solarized base3.

color.name: header
color.description: Muted blue-gray for headers and secondary content. Solarized base00.

color.name: muted
color.description: Light gray for captions, metadata. Solarized base1.

color.name: surface
color.description: Slightly darker cream for cards and elevated surfaces

color.name: red
color.description: Warm coral red - passion, emphasis, primary actions

color.name: pink
color.description: Dusty rose - soft romantic moments, gentle emphasis

color.name: green
color.description: Sage green - positive changes, growth, success

fleuron-colors.description: The signature decorative element - a row of colored dots used as subtle section dividers
fleuron-colors.sequence: red, orange, yellow, pink, green, blue, purple
fleuron-colors.usage: Section breaks, footer accent, subtle personality marker

motion.principle: Gentle and friendly. Movement should feel welcoming, like being greeted by a clever friend. A slight bounce is acceptable - this aesthetic has personality. Content should slide in smoothly, never jarring.

animation.name: gentle-enter
animation.description: Content enters with a friendly slight bounce
animation.keyframes: from { opacity: 0; transform: translateY(16px); } to { opacity: 1; transform: translateY(0); }

animation.name: slide-up
animation.description: Smooth upward slide for cards and panels
animation.keyframes: from { opacity: 0; transform: translateY(24px); } to { opacity: 1; transform: translateY(0); }

animation.name: button-press

allowed.reason: This aesthetic embraces warmth and playfulness

avoid.reason: Playful doesn't mean chaotic. Wit is controlled.

backgrounds.principle: Warm and inviting. The cream base provides comfort. Subtle texture adds depth without distraction. Backgrounds should feel like quality paper stock.

treatment.name: surface-card
treatment.description: Elevated surface for cards with soft shadow

treatment.description: Subtle paper texture for rich, tactile feel

treatment.name: gradient-warm
treatment.description: Subtle warm gradient for hero sections

components.principle: Friendly and touchable. Rounded corners convey approachability. Generous padding gives content room to breathe. Components should feel like well-designed app elements within a publication context.

layout.principle: Generous whitespace is essential. Content needs room to breathe. The publication heritage means thoughtful margins; the app nature means clear, tappable targets. Balance editorial elegance with interactive usability.

spacing.note: Default to larger spacing. Cramped layouts feel anxious, not witty.

pattern.name: hub-grid
pattern.description: Grid of app link cards - responsive, generous gaps

pattern.name: editorial-column
pattern.description: Single column content with comfortable max-width

iconography.principle: Friendly line icons with rounded terminals. Think of well-designed app icons that feel approachable. Consistent stroke weight, balanced proportions.

style.color: Inherit from text color or use accent for interactive

decorative.principle: The fleuron (row of colored dots) is the signature decorative element. Use as a subtle accent - a wink, not a shout. It represents the full spectrum of personality while maintaining restraint.

fleuron.description: A horizontal row of small colored circles, one for each accent color in sequence

specifications.colors: red, orange, yellow, pink, green, blue, purple

fleuron.note: As a subtle accent, do not overuse. One or two instances per page maximum.

blockquote-indicator.description: Vertical colored bar indicating pull quotes or callouts
blockquote-indicator.note: Color can vary by context - use any accent color
